metadata.titel_preek: Sermon 28: God Is All to All
metadata.bijbeltekst: Psalm 105:3; Psalm 36:10; Psalm 51:8; 2 Corinthians 2:15; Matthew 5:6; 1 Corinthians 1:30; John 6:51

dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: GOD IS NOURISHMENT / TRUTH IS FOOD

kernfrasen: steer it and lead it all the way over to you
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS SEEKING / INCARNATION IS A JOURNEY

kernfrasen: object of the wealthy man’s avarice
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: DIVINE GRACE IS AN INEXHAUSTIBLE RESOURCE

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: One eats well but digests poorly if he hears God’s word without putting it into practice.

cognitieve_implicaties: Hearing is only the first stage of a biological-like process.
Information must be transformed into action to be useful.
theologische_implicaties: The Word is ontological fuel, not just data.
ethische_implicaties: A 'full' listener who doesn't act is spiritually sick/indigestive.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests that the Word could become 'toxic' or 'bitter' if not handled correctly.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'Bread of Life' cliché by focusing on the visceral, unpleasant details of indigestion and starvation.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon is remarkably coherent because it uses the 'Senses' as a unifying framework. It systematically maps God onto Light (Sight), Music (Hearing), Fragrance (Smell), and Bread (Taste), all under the overarching meta-metaphor of 'God as the Source of Life-Sustaining Input.'

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Analogy: The preacher uses the physical mechanics of speech (thought using sound as a vehicle) to explain the metaphysics of the Incarnation (Word using the body as a vehicle).

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the source domain of 'Light' by describing the physical death of eyes in darkness.
sterktes.voorbeeld: their eyes had died of starvation... from not having seen light.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing entirely on God as nourishment and sensory delight, the 'Judge' or 'Sovereign' aspects of God are absent.
risicos.voorbeeld: God is at one and the same time light, harmony, fragrance and food.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God only as a source of personal satisfaction.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A banquet hall where guests are waiting for savory platters.
sub_worlds: A dark dungeon where eyes starve
A trade ship carrying exotic fruit
The internal space of the mind where thoughts are 'loaded' onto sound

deictic_shifts.naar_wereld: A trade ship on the high seas
deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Effective contrast between 'local/accessible' grace and 'exotic/expensive' commodities.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Repeated emphasis on God as the source of all sensory and spiritual input.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Explaining how light and sound are not diminished by being shared.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Infinite Abundance (The more who partake, the more is present).

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the Lenten fast mentioned in §1.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the Medical/Biological domain (Nourishment) and the Physical/Sensory domain. It brilliantly avoids the 'Economic' trap of grace by using the physics of light and sound to prove that spiritual goods are non-rivalrous. The landscape is one of 'Internalization'—moving from the ears/eyes to the 'inner man.'

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'bread' to the 'trade ship' imagery more deeply.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the salt-spray and the cost of the ship to contrast with the 'free' bread of Christ.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'God is none of it' to 'God is all of it' in §2.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Sun' metaphor more explicitly—the sun is not the things it illuminates, yet it is the source of their visibility.

entailment_checks.metafoor: Thought as Cargo on a Vehicle (Sound)
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Suggests the 'Vehicle' (the Body of Christ) is discarded once the 'Cargo' (the Word) is delivered.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify the permanent union of the two natures to avoid Nestorian entailments.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To balance the 'digestion' metaphor with 'growth' (the result of digestion).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in cognitive homiletics. The preacher successfully moves the congregation from physical hunger (fasting) to metaphysical hunger using embodied sensory mappings.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'dulcet harmonies' prose, CMT reveals these are cognitive bridges to understand the non-rivalrous nature of God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's experiential learning, CMT shows that the 'experience' is actually built into the language itself through the mapping of 'digestion' to 'obedience.'
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher is using 'Physics' (light/sound properties) as a source domain to solve the theological problem of God's omnipresence (being 'whole and entire' in many places).

appendices.notities: The preacher uses the 'Container' schema heavily—God in the heart, thought in the mind, Word in the Virgin's womb.
